title: drive: rclone --dry-run will say it has to make (empty) directories that already exist

milestone.title: Known Problem
milestone.description: This milestone contains issues which are known problems which are proving difficult to fix, or are awaiting an external fix or we haven't got round to yet.

body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
Empty directories are being correctly copied for some time now. With v1.45, --dry-run stopped creating these directories, correctly.
However, since v1.45, it will say "Not making directory as dry run is set" for directories that already exist in the destination.


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
v1.45

Haven't tried the github version because nothing on the log indicated any related change


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Linux 64bits


####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive


#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone -v --dry-run --track-renames sync drive:dir1 drive2:dir2


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
(the following log was edited to remove lots and lots of file references and make it more readable)

2018/11/28 17:48:24 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.45" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "--dry-run" "--track-renames" "sync" "drive1:dir1" "drive2:/dir1"]
